column2: [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"|a letter]] to [[T.P. Dunning|T.P. ("Tom") Dunning]]'''
column6: Manuscripts & Works on Paper: The 30th Anniversary Sale

column3: loosely inserted in Dunning's copy of ''[[Farmer Giles of Ham]]''
340 including feeds fees) at Bloomsbury on 30 May 2013.

column1: {{Quote|In the letter Tolkien apologises 'that [[Farmer Giles of Ham|this]] is only half a book. Even so it cost me great pains.' He goes on to mention his health 'Am going away on Friday next by Doctor's orders to ''me'' not to [[Edith Tolkien|Edith]]
column2: though she is pretty groggy. I am now nearly out of juice: mental
